text: hey everyone I've got a spare air-cooled
diffusion pump this actually came out of
my home-built scanning electron
microscope and instead of selling it on
eBay I thought I would give it away to
someone who could make good use of it
but I don't know who that person would
be so I thought I'd have a informal
contest so if you're interested in this
please send me an email
keep it short maybe less than 500 words
or post a video response and keep it
short probably about under two minutes
and I'll try to find the best response
that I can what I'm looking for is for
someone to use this equipment and either
write blog post or make videos about
what they're doing so in your submission
please tell me what interests you about
high vacuum and how you plan to make use
of it what you'll receive is that the
pump itself this is an air-cooled
varying diffusion pump it's 350 Watts
120 volt and I think it's better it's
about a three inch throat there and
you'll also receive about a hundred and
thirty milliliters of DC 704 pump oil
that's enough for two charges some
o-rings and also a custom-built baffle
this is a water-cooled baffle if you
don't use the baffle the pump oil will
stream back up into your chamber it
won't work very well so of course to use
this what you'll need is a vacuum
chamber and also a vacuum pump you can
use like a cheap one from Harbor Freight
or if you happen to have a nicer one
already I'll run the contest until the
end of the month and the order in which
I receive the submissions is not
important so take your time and I'll try
to come to a conclusion about the person
who's going to make best use of this and
also publish their work a standard legal
disclaimers apply so once I send this to
you it's going to be all yours and all
liabilities will be yours as well so if
you somehow create a black hole it's up
the world--in will be all your fault
okay I look forward to hearing from you
